1.title: All Good Things Must Come to an End
1.plot: Misaki Takahashi has been living with his secret boyfriend, the rich and famous boys-love author Akihiko Usami (Usagi), for three years now. He thinks nothing's changed between them or inside his own heart in that time but, is he just fooling himself? His older brother (Takahiro) visits and tells him he will have to leave Usagi soon. Misaki meets a boy in the university named Todo who is like Misaki as he also loves Ijuuin's work: the Kan. Usagi reveals he is prepared to tell Takahiro about Misaki and his relationship because he refuses to lose him. Akihiko's cousin ...

1.title: Jijitsu wa shousetsu yori mo ki nari
1.plot: "Truth is stranger than fiction"-- Meet Misaki, an average high school student, and Akihiko, a famous novelist. These two happen to meet when Misaki stumbles upon Akihiko hugging his brother, whom Akihiko has feelings for.

2.title: Koukai saki ni tatazu
2.plot: "No use crying over spilt milk" --- A month has passed and Misaki has been accepted by the department of Economics at Mitsuhashi University. Ever since the second day of school, everyone acts weird towards Misaki and avoids him. His new friend Sumi Keiichi tells him everyone wonders how he knows Akihiko Usami, the famous writer. Usami acts jealous of Misaki's new friend, and Misaki wonders if Usami only likes him as a substitute for his brother. They argue, Usami admits he was jealous, and then they make love. Usami realizes he is falling in love with Misaki and ...

3.title: Tatakeyo saraba hirakaren
3.plot: "Knock and it shall be opened unto you" -- Hiroki Kamijou is sitting in a park remembering his fruitless relationship with his childhood friend and crush, Akihiko Usami. His thoughts are abruptly disturbed when Nowaki Kusama launches a toy rocket, almost hitting him. Nowaki sees him crying and drags him off to a group of men watching the rocket. Hiroki learns that Nowaki is a foundling. Nowaki later insists on Hiroki becoming his tutor, to help him with the high school proficiency exam. Akihiko makes a surprise visit, but Nowaki interrupts and confesses his love for ...

4.title: Fear Is Often Greater Than the Danger Itself
4.plot: Akihiko might write his fair share of boy's love novels, but he also writes mainstream books that have won several awards and made him famous throughout Japan. As such, he has a very close relationship with his editor; she even has a key to his apartment. Misaki finds that very strange... could there be more between those two than meets the eye?

5.title: Meeting Is the Beginning of Parting
5.plot: Five years after Hiroki and Nowaki met, Nowaki disappeared without a trace. For a year he was gone, and Hiroki thought he might never see Nowaki again. But then a simple postcard arrived in the mail: "It's been a while. I will be returning to the country on May 30th." Hiroki is swept up again, fighting between love and hatred for the unpredictable, irresistible Nowaki.

6.title: Good Can Come Out of Misfortune
6.plot: Feeling insecure about their relationship and looking for some way to connect, Nowaki asks Hiroki if he can call him the same friendly nickname everyone else does. When Hiroki flat out refuses, Nowaki's feelings are hurt. Can he find some other way to bridge the gap between them or is their relationship going nowhere?

7.title: Spare the Rod and Spoil the Child
7.plot: Misaki keeps mulling over an important question... are he and Akihiko actually "going out"? They live together, eat together, and get pretty intimate with each other, but it doesn't seem like the kind of lovey-dovey relationship that couples usually have. So Akihiko settles the problem swiftly, by declaring that they're going out on a date!

8.title: Away from Home, One Needs Feel No Shame
8.plot: Usagi tells Misaki that he is going to go back to living with Takahiro. Misaki believes that he has become a burden to Usagi, so he doesn't object. He goes to visit his brother in Osaka. At his brother's home he realizes this is what a normal family should feel like, but ends up getting mad when Takahiro starts criticizing Usagi. Misaki begins to notice he feels lonely. Usagi is at home and constantly thinking about Misaki. It is revealed that he let Misaki go because Takahiro said that Misaki blames himself for their parents' deaths. Misaki phones Usagi from the ...

9.title: One Good Turn Deserves Another
9.plot: Desperate to get Akihiko's latest work completed, Aikawa begs Misaki to teach him what a "real date" is like for a college student. The date gets much more complicated when a present from Akihiko's father for Misaki arrives and it puts Akihiko in a bad mood.

10.title: Shonen yo Taishi o Idake
10.plot: "Boys, be ambitious" --- Teenage Takatsuki Shinobu makes a love confession to his ex-brother-in-law, Miyagi Yo. Three years prior, when two thugs tried to mug Shinobu, and Miyagi ran them off. They both ended up at the same marriage arrangement meeting for Miyagi and Shinobu's sister, Risako. Now, it is revealed Miyagi has divorced Risako, and Shinobu has returned from studying abroad, in Australia, when he heard the news. When Miyagi is asked to house Shinobu, the two form an uneasy relationship. Miyagi challenges Shinobu's earnest declaration of adoration by making ...

11.title: Suki koso mono no jouzu nare
11.plot: "All Things Are Easy That Are Done Willingly" -- Miyagi and Shinobu's story continues. As Miyagi walks to his car Risako arrives to get one last item and comments that she felt Miyagi should have been more honest with her about his feelings. When she leaves he has a flashback of staying by someone's bedside and an empty wheelchair. His ruminations are interrupted by Shinobu's arrival home. Miyagi tries to make a hasty exit and in the process, drops a photo he'd been looking at. Shinobu presses him for details but Miyagi tells him to mind his own business. Shinobu once...

12.title: Sode suri au mo tashounoen
12.plot: "There's No Such Thing As A Chance Encounter" -- To convince Takahiro to let Misaki stay with him, Usami has told outrageous lies, all of which Takahiro believes. The next day, Keiichi tells Misaki to congratulate Usami for winning the Kikukawa Prize, but Misaki worries suddenly it might be for one of the explicit BL books. When he gets home Usami, Isaka, and Aikawa talking about preparations for a celebration party. The manager mentions that Haruhiko, Usami's older brother will be present, which troubles Usami. The two adults rush Usami off to the press conference, ...

1.title: What Happens Once Can Happen Twice
1.plot: Akihiko hates company parties and when he refuses to attend one thrown in his honor, Isaki doesn't hold back on the dirty tricks. He tricks Misaki into going in order to get Akihiko to go. On the way to the party, Misaki ends up helping a man who seems rather lost at the train station, but the biggest surprise of the night may be when Misaki discovers who this mystery man is!

2.title: What Happens Twice Can Happen Thrice
2.plot: When Haruhiko sends Misaki flowers, Akihiko starts getting jealous because Misaki refuses to say he loves him. Then, when Isaki pressures Misaki to stay away from Akihiko in order to protect his public image, Misaki himself starts to question their relationship. Where exactly do they stand?

3.title: Third Time's a Charm
3.plot: With gifts arriving from Haruhiko daily, Masaki attempts to ask him to stop but Haruhiko doesn't seem to be listening. Instead, he whisks Masaki away to the massive family mansion - an absolute lap of luxury. When Haruhiko offers to allow Masaki to live in the family mansion, will he be persuaded to leave Akihiko?

4.title: The Mouth Is the Gate of Misfortune
4.plot: Nowaki is feeling insecure about his relationship with Hiro and he wants Hiro to be more proactive. He's not even sure whether Hiro likes living with him. Coincidentally, Hiro calls and asks Nowaki to bring some materials to him at the university. At the gates, Miyagi turns up and teases Hiro, calling him Hiroki, which annoys Hiro but puzzles Nowaki. He asks Hiro if he can call him Hiroki and Hiro says no. Hiro meets Nowaki at work the next morning and in passing, Akihiko calls Hiro" Hiroki" which annoys Niwaki who then drags Hiro away. Later back in their apartment ...

5.title: Many a True Word Is Spoken in Jest
5.plot: Needing a little space, Misaki wants to hang out with his friend Sumi from school, but Akihiko is dead set against it. Is this unreasonable jealousy on Akihiko's part or does Sumi really have more on his mind than just friendship with Masaki?

6.title: A Picture Is Worth a Thousand Words
6.plot: When Hiroki discovers Nowaki and Tsumori in a compromising position, he's not sure what to think. Nowaki tries to explain, but Tsumori doesn't seem to want to help clear up the matter. When Tsumori casually mentions that Nowaki is thinking of moving out, it jars Hiroki. Is Nowaki leaving him?

7.title: Life Often Brings Misfortune in Times of Great Happiness
7.plot:

8.title: Love Does Not Follow Logic
8.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

9.title: Out of the Frying Pan, Into the Fire
9.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

10.title: Marriage Is Made in Heaven
10.plot: Right after the TV reports that Haruhiko is getting married, his fiancée turns up on Akihiko's doorstep, begging him to marry her instead! As if things weren't complicated enough, Akihiko also turns up and it seems that it's an arranged marriage and he doesn't want to get married to her either because he still has eyes for Misaki!

11.title: Hate the Sin But Love the Sinner
11.plot: A call for a family meeting seems to annoy Akihiko, but despite his numerous attempts to get out of it, he winds up going. Afterwards, Misaki and Akihiko head to a hot springs for a little relaxation, but wind up meeting up with Akihiko's father instead.

12.title: All's Well That Ends Well
12.plot: Akihiko and Misaki head to the publisher to deliver Akihiko's latest manuscript. When the two are pulled apart by business, Misaki is cornered by Haruhiko who is still determined to claim Misaki as his own.

imdb.plot outline: Misaki Takahasi is the 18-year-old (19 in episode 8 of Junjo Romantica) little brother of Takahiro. At the start of the series, Misaki is about to sit for his college entrance examinations. His dream is to go to Mitsuhashi University since that was the college his brother turned down so that he could begin taking care of Misaki after their parents died. Although seemingly childish and brash, Misaki is later revealed to be a person who is simply adamant on insisting against doing anything that might be troublesome for anyone else. This is due to the fact that he still blames himself for his parents' death (believing that if he had not asked them to hurry home, they would not have sped in the rain and crashed). Misaki and Usami eventually begin a relationship together which puzzles Misaki, who is not outwardly confident about his feelings towards the older man because of his narrow view of a typical relationship. In the anime adaption, he is voiced by Takahiro Sakurai

Although seemingly childish and brash, Misaki is later revealed to be a person who is simply adamant on insisting against doing anything that might be troublesome for anyone else. This is due to the fact that he still blames himself for his parents' death (believing that if he had not asked them to hurry home, they would not have sped in the rain and crashed). Misaki and Usami eventually begin a relationship together which puzzles Misaki, who is not outwardly confident about his feelings towards the older man because of his narrow view of a typical relationship.
